Articles.Content: Why use a large parachute when they have the same stats as the smaller ones?
Actually, it doesn't. The small chute is designed for the one Kerbal capsule and its larger cousin for the three Kerbal capsule.
Explain "designed"? What is the statistical difference between the two?

Explain "designed"? What is the statistical difference between the two?

Basically, the more parachute weighs, the more effective it is.
you have a drag parachute to slow a bit down and for pointing the good way and one for slow a lot so you use the drag one's first and another one second
Well, the game is still in alpha. Stat balancing comes later.

Weight. Parachutes are heavy.

Also, Smaller chutes give less drag in game, but not in the stats.
The answer is that the "drag" stat is "drag ratio." Two parts with drag=1.0 do not have the same aerodynamic drag force in the same atmosphere at the same speed unless they are the same mass.
The 'drag factor' (which is the same for both, yes), gets scaled by the weight of the object. So the large chute, weighing X (3?) times as much, has X times the drag.
